title: Resolution Architect
description: Don't just wish, plan. 20 strategic questions to ensure your goals actually stick this year.

cards.content: Does this resolution come from self-love or self-loathing?
cards.back: Self-loathing goals fail. Find a love-based reason.

cards.content: How can I make this new habit 20 seconds easier to start?
cards.back: Reduce friction. (e.g., pack gym bag tonight).

cards.content: How can I make the bad habit I want to break 20 seconds harder?
cards.back: Increase friction. (e.g., hide the remote).

cards.content: How can I shift my identity to match this goal?
cards.back: Don't say 'I want to run'. Say 'I am a runner'.

cards.content: When (not if) I slip up in week 3, what is the plan?
cards.back: Create a 'Failure Protocol' now.

cards.content: To make space for this new goal, what current activity am I deleting?
cards.back: You cannot just add. You must subtract.

cards.content: Is this goal ambitious enough to scare me into action?
cards.back: Or is it safe enough to let me procrastinate?

cards.content: Am I willing to lose the friends who bond with me over my bad habits?
cards.back: The social cost of growth.

cards.content: Am I measuring the outcome or the input?
cards.back: Focus on the input (e.g., 'Walk 10k steps', not 'Lose 10lbs').

cards.content: Am I willing to tolerate the boredom of consistency?
cards.back: Motivation is fun. Consistency is boring.

cards.content: Does my bedroom/office look like the room of someone who achieves this?
cards.back: Change your environment to match the goal.

cards.content: How will I know when I have succeeded?
cards.back: Define 'Enough'.

cards.content: Is the first step of this habit so small it takes less than 2 minutes?
cards.back: If not, shrink it.

cards.content: Who will know if I fail?
cards.back: If the answer is 'no one', get an accountability partner.

cards.content: What specifically am I willing to SUFFER to achieve this?
cards.back: Define the trade-off.

cards.content: Is there any way to make this hard thing enjoyable?
cards.back: Pair it with music, a podcast, or a friend.

cards.content: How am I tracking this visibly?
cards.back: Don't keep it in your head. Put it on the wall.

cards.content: Imagine itâ€™s next December and I failed. Why did it happen?
cards.back: The Pre-Mortem. Fix that cause now.

cards.content: How can I automate this decision?
cards.back: Don't use willpower. Use systems.

cards.content: If I only accomplish ONE thing this year, what makes the rest irrelevant?
cards.back: Focus on that one thing.
